column1: Chiggers are tiny, 6-legged wingless organisms (larvae) that mature to become a type of mite.
The main symptoms of chigger bites are: - Severe itching - Red pimple-like bumps or hives Itching usually occurs several hours after the chiggers attach to the skin.
This is often a clue that the rash is due to chigger bites.
Your health care provider can diagnose chiggers by examining the rash.
